title: Retracted coronavirus (COVID-19) papers
description: via CDC We've been tracking retractions of papers about COVID-19 as part of our database. Here's a running list, which will be updated as needed. (For some context on these figures, see...
cleaned_text: We've been tracking retractions of papers about COVID-19 as part of our [database](http://retractiondatabase.org). Here's a running list, which will be updated as needed. (For some context on these figures, see [this post](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/12/30/list-of-retracted-covid-19-papers-grows-past-70/), our [letter in Accountability in Research](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/08989621.2020.1793675) and the last section of this [Nature news article](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-020-03564-y). Also see a note about the terminology regarding preprint servers at the end.) Retracted - " [5G Technology and induction of coronavirus in skin cells](https://www.biolifesas.org/biolife/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/FIORANELLI.pdf)," published in Biological Regulators & Homeostatic Agents on July 16, 2020, [withdrawn on July 24, 2020](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32668870/). Our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/07/26/paper-blaming-covid-19-on-5g-technology-withdrawn/). - " [6-month consequences of COVID-19 in patients discharged from hospital: a cohort study](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673620326568)," published on January 8, 2021 in the Lancet; [EOC](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673622023704/)issued on November 24, 2022, [retracted and republished](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673623011753)on June 8, 2023. See our coverage [here](https://retractionwatch.com/2022/12/01/buzzy-lancet-long-covid-paper-under-investigation-for-data-errors/)and [here](https://retractionwatch.com/2023/06/13/highly-cited-lancet-long-covid-study-retracted-and-republished/). - " [A Case Series of Stent Thrombosis During the COVID-19 Pandemic,"](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2666084920305842)published on May 27, 2020 in JACC: Case Reports; retraction date is unknown. Retracted as a duplicate publication by journal error. - " [A Comparison of Early Rehabilitation in the Intensive Care Units of Patients With Severe COVID-19: A Propensity Score Matching Analysis](https://www.cureus.com/articles/124048-a-comparison-of-early-rehabilitation-in-the-intensive-care-units-of-patients-with-severe-covid-19-a-propensity-score-matching-analysis#!/authors)," published November 10, 2022 in Cureus; [retracted](https://www.cureus.com/articles/124048-a-comparison-of-early-rehabilitation-in-the-intensive-care-units-of-patients-with-severe-covid-19-a-propensity-score-matching-analysis/retraction#!/)on April 4, 2023. - " [A data-mining based analysis of traditional Chinese medicine in diagnosing and treating COVID-19](https://anatomypubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/ar.24677?s=03)," published on June 24, 2021 in The Anatomical Record; unknown when [retracted](https://anatomypubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/ar.24677?s=03). - " [A deep learning model and machine learning methods for the classification of potential coronavirus treatments on a single human cell](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11051-020-05041-z)," published on October 17, 2020 in the Journal of Nanoparticle Research; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs11051-021-05266-6)on August 16, 2021. - " [A Discourse Analysis of Quotidian Expressions of Nationalism during the COVID-19 Pandemic in Chinese Cyberspace](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11366-020-09692-6)," published on September 8, 2020; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11366-022-09799-y)on April 12, 2022. - " [A fuzzy rough hybrid decision making technique for identifying the infected population of COVID-19](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-020-05451-0)," published on November 23, 2020 in Soft Computing; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-023-08598-8)on May 29, 2023. - " [A mechanistic analysis placental intravascular thrombus formation in COVID-19 patients](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1092913420300708)," published on April 25, 2020 in Annals of Diagnostic Pathology. Retracted on June 22, 2020 as a duplicate publication by journal error. - " [A meta-analysis of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) antibody treatment for COVID-19 patients](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/20406223211039699)," published on August 20, 2021 in Therapeutic Advances in Chronic Disease; [retracted](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/20406223211056430)on November 21, 2021. See our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2021/12/02/authors-retract-resubmit-very-poorly-conducted-meta-analysis-of-covid-19-treatment/). - " [A Model Based Analysis for COVID-19 Pandemic in India: Implications for Health Systems and Policy for Low- and Middle-Income Countries](https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.06.11.20128231v1?versioned=true)," preprint possted on June 12, 2020 in medRxiv; [retracted](https://www.medrxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.06.11.20128231v2)on August 18, 2020. - " [A new emergency response of spherical intelligent fuzzy decision process to diagnose of COVID19](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-020-05287-8)," published on October 1, 2020 in Soft Computing; [corrected](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-020-05570-8)on January 9, 2021; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-023-08593-z)on May 29, 2023. - " [A new prediction approach of the COVID-19 virus pandemic behavior with a hybrid ensemble modular nonlinear autoregressive neural network](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-020-05452-z)," published on November 19, 2020 in Soft Computing; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-023-08964-6)on July 10, 2023. - " [A psychosocial exploration of body dissatisfaction: A narrative review With a focus on India during COVID-19](https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fgwh.2021.669013/full)," published on July 29, 2021 in Frontiers in Global Women's Health; [retracted](https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fgwh.2022.1124853/full)on January 19, 2023. - " [A qualitative study of the impact of COVID 19, on health care providers for cancer patients: An original research](https://www.jpbsonline.org/article.asp?issn=0975-7406;year=2021;volume=13;issue=6;spage=1341;epage=1344;aulast=Jha)," published on November 10, 2021 in the Journal of Pharmacy & Bioallied Sciences; [retracted](https://www.jpbsonline.org/article.asp?issn=0975-7406;year=2022;volume=14;issue=5;spage=1093;epage=1093;aulast=)on July 13, 2022. - " [A Report on Myocarditis Adverse Events in the U.S. Vaccine Adverse Events Reporting System (VAERS) in Association with COVID-19 Injectable Biological Products](https://web.archive.org/web/20211007022704/https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0146280621002267#)," published on October 1, 2021 in Current Problems in Cardiology, temporarily retracted on October 15, 2021. Our [coverage here](http://retractionwatch.com/2021/10/17/paper-linking-covid-19-vaccines-to-myocarditis-is-temporarily-removed-without-explanation/). - " [A Retrospective Analysis and Comparison of Prisoners and Community-Based Patients with COVID-19 Requiring Intensive Care During the First Phase of the Pandemic in West Texas](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/2150132720954687)," published on November 2, 2020 in the Journal of Primary Care & Community Health; [retracted](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/21501327211033367)on July 16, 2021 - " [A review of convalescent plasma transfusion in COVID-19: Old wine reserved for special occasions](https://www.lungindia.com/preprintarticle.asp?id=295234)," published in Lung India on September 16, 2020; [retracted December 31, 2020](https://www.lungindia.com/article.asp?issn=0970-2113;year=2021;volume=38;issue=1;spage=105;epage=105;aulast=). - " [A Systematic Review of Autopsy Findings in Deaths after COVID-19 Vaccination](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4496137)," published on July 5, 2023 in SSRN: Preprints with The Lancet; [retracted](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4496137)on July 6, 2023. - " [A study of COVID-19 in the Wuhan, Beijing, Urumqi and Dalian cities based on the regional disease vulnerability index](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1876034121002537)," published on September 4, 2021 in the Journal of Infection and Public Health; [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1876034121002537)on unknown date for publisher error in duplicate publishing. - " [A Study of Potential SARS-CoV-2 Antiviral Drugs and Preliminary Research of Their Molecular Mechanism, Based on Anti-SARS-CoV Drug Screening and Molecular Dynamics Simulation](https://www.liebertpub.com/doi/10.1089/cmb.2020.0112?url_ver=Z39.88-2003&rfr_id=ori:rid:crossref.org&rfr_dat=cr_pub%20%200pubmed)," published on December 1, 2020 in the Journal of Computational Biology; [retracted](https://www.liebertpub.com/doi/10.1089/cmb.2020.0112.retract)on June 25, 2021. - " [A thematic analysis of system wide learning from first wave Covid-19 in the east of England](https://bmchealthservres.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12913-022-07797-7)," publishing on April 25, 2022 in BMC Health Services Research; [retracted](https://bmchealthservres.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12913-022-08263-0)on July " [A topic-based hierarchical publish/subscribe messaging middleware for COVID-19 detection in X-ray image and its metadata](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-020-05387-5)," published on October 19, 2020 in Soft Computing; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00500-023-08599-7)on May 29, 2023. - " [Accurate computation: COVID-19 rRT-PCR positive test dataset using stages classification through textual big data mining with machine learning](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11227-020-03586-3)," published on January 4, 2021 in The Journal of Supercomputing; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11227-022-04937-y)on November 21, 2022. - "Acute kidney injury and collapsing glomerulopathy associated with COVID-19 and APOL1 high risk genotype," Abstract 111 and Abstract 621, both published in the Journal of Investigative Medicine; both [retracted](https://jim.bmj.com/content/69/4/948)on April 1, 2021. - " [Acute necrotizing and acute motor axonal neuropathy in a COVID-19 patient,](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs00415-020-10145-6)" published in Journal of Neurology on August 9, 2020; unknown date of retraction. - " [Addressing the Mental Health Needs of Filipino Child Victims of Online Sexual Exploitation During the COVID-19 Crisis: Challenges in Implementing Online Intervention Studies for Vulnerable Populations](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/10105395211073282)," published on January 11, 2022 in the Asia Pacific Journal of Public Health; [retracted](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/10105395221078477)on February 22, 2022. - " [Advancing ambulatory pharmacy practice through a crisis: Objectives and strategies used in an ambulatory care action team's response to the COVID-19 pandemic](https://academic.oup.com/ajhp/article/79/8/e96/6114339?searchresult=1)," published on January 23, 2021 in the American Journal of Health-System Pharmacy; [retracted](https://academic.oup.com/ajhp/article/79/8/e96/6114339?searchresult=1)on April 1, 2022 due to published error causing duplicate publication. - " [AI Techniques for COVID-19](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9136710)," published in IEEE Access on July 8, 2020; [retracted](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9136710)in October (exact date unknown). - " [An adaptive speech signal processing for COVID-19 detection using deep learning approach](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10772-021-09878-0)," published on August 21, 2021 in the International Journal of Speech Technology; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10772-022-09993-6)on October 13, 2022. - " [An effective protective equipment to use in the vaginal delivery of the pregnant women with suspected/diagnosed COVID-19: Delivery Table Shield](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0002937820306384)," published in the American Journal of Obstetrics and Gynecology on June 15, 2020, withdrawn sometime before June 25, 2020. Retracted and reinstated. Republished on unknown date, no explanation given. Our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/06/25/journal-temporarily-withdraws-covid-19-labor-cage-study/). - "An epidemiological investigation of a new coronavirus pneumonia cluster epidemic spread in public transportation" (also titled "An epidemiological investigation of 2019 novel coronavirus diseases through aerosol-borne transmission by public transport"), published in early March in Practical Preventive Medicine and [retracted](http://c61.cnki.net/cjfd/Withdraw/SYYY/SYYY20200304003.pdf)sometime in mid-April. More context [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/04/22/study-claiming-broader-spread-of-aerosolized-coronavirus-is-retracted/). - " [An Intelligent Mechanism for COVID-19 Emergency Resource Coordination and Follow-Up Response](https://www.hindawi.com/journals/cin/2022/2005188/)," published on June 20, 2022 in Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience; [retracted](https://www.hindawi.com/journals/cin/2023/9849710/)on July 26, 2023. - " [Anal swab as the potentially optimal specimen for SARS-CoV-2 detection to evaluate the hospital discharge of COVID-19 patients](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7493721/)," published on August 14, 2020 in Future Microbiology; [retracted](https://www.futuremedicine.com/doi/10.2217/fmb-2020-0090r1?url_ver=Z39.88-2003&rfr_id=ori:rid:crossref.org&rfr_dat=cr_pub%20%200pubmed)on April 13 2021. - " [Analysis of 329,942 SARS-CoV-2 records retrieved from GISAID database](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0010482521007757)," published on October 26, 2021 in Computers in Biology and Medicine; [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0010482522003195?via%3Dihub)on April 20, 2022. - " [Analysis of Conocurvone, Ganoderic acid A and Oleuropein molecules against the main protease molecule of COVID-19 by in silico approaches: Molecular dynamics docking studies,](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0955799723001005)" published on February 27, 2023 in Engineering Analysis with Boundary Elements; [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0955799723004162)on August 16, 2023. - " [Analysis of Ten Microsecond simulation data of SARS-CoV-2 dimeric main protease](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.04.10.036020v2)," preprint posted on bioRxiv, April 12, 2020, withdrawn April 16, 2020. - " [Analysis of thin-section CT in patients with coronavirus disease (COVID-19) after hospital discharge](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S089970712030156X)," published on May 15, 2020 in Clinical Imaging; retraction date/reason is unknown. - " [Analysis of Urban Residents' Consumption Behavior and Influencing Factors of Ecological Agricultural Products in the Post-Pandemic Era of COVID-19](https://www.hindawi.com/journals/abb/2022/8382247/)," published on May 14, 2022 in Applied Bionics and Biomechanics; [retracted](https://www.hindawi.com/journals/abb/2022/9876949/)on November 21, 2022. - " [Antiviral treatment could not provide clinical benefit in management of mild COVID-19: A Retrospective Experience from Field hospital](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1876034121002161)," published on July 31, 2021 in the Journal of Infection and Public Health; unknown date of retraction. - " [Application of embedded computer and improved genetic algorithm in the strategy of community of human destiny: the development of artificial intelligence in the context of Covid-19](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12652-021-03218-5)," published on April 9, 2021 in the Journal of Ambient Intelligence and Humanized Computing; [retracted](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12652-021-03218-5)on October 30, 2022. - " [Assessing the Dissemination of COVID-19 Articles Across Social Media With Altmetric and PlumX Metrics: Correlational Study](https://www.jmir.org/2021/1/e21408/)," published on June 13, 2020 as a preprint, and January 14, 2021 as an article in the Journal of Medical Internet Research; [retracted](https://www.jmir.org/2022/8/e41544/)on July 29, 2022. - " [Assessment of COVID-19 pandemic effects on ship pollutant emissions in major international seaports](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.envres.2021.112246)," published on October 23, 2021 in Environmental Research; retraction date/reason is unknown. - " [Association of Initial Viral Load in Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) Patients with Outcome and Symptoms](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0002944020303333)," published on July 7, 2020 in The American Journal of Pathology; retraction date is unknown. Retracted as a duplicate publication by journal error. - " [Atorvastatin versus Placebo in ICU Patients with COVID-19: Ninety-day Results of the INSPIRATION-S Trial](https://www.thieme-connect.com/products/ejournals/abstract/10.1055/a-2059-4844)," published on March 21, 2023 in Thrombosis and Haemostasis; [temporarily retracted](https://www.thieme-connect.com/products/ejournals/abstract/10.1055/a-2059-4844)on unknown date. - " [Autopsy and Histologic Findings of Patients with New Coronavirus Pneumonia: The Pathologic Associations with Hypoxemia](https://www.medscimonit.com/abstract/index/idArt/928837)," published on February 13, 2020 in Medical Science Monitor; [retracted](https://www.medscimonit.com/abstract/index/idArt/932092)on March 17, 2021. - " [Ayurvedic management of moderate COVID-19 infection: A case report](https://www.ayucare.org/article.asp?issn=2667-0593;year=2020;volume=3;issue=2;spage=46;epage=50;aulast=Sharma)," published on October 16, 2020 in the Journal of Ayurveda Case Reports; [retracted](https://www.ayucare.org/article.asp?issn=2667-0593;year=2020;volume=3;issue=3;spage=118;epage=118;aulast=)on January 18, 2021. - " [Basic Demographic Parameters Help Predict Outcomes in Patients Hospitalized With COVID-19 During the First Wave of Infection in West Texas](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/2150132720970717)," published on November 2, 2020 in the Journal of Primary Care & Community Health; [retracted](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/21501327211033367)on July 16, 2021. - " [Because if I don't hold his hand then I might as well not be there": Experiences of Dutch and UK care home visiting during the COVID-19 pandemic](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1525861021008215)," published on September 17, 2021 in the Journal of the American Medical Directors Association; unknown date of [retraction](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1525861021008215). - " [Biopsychosocial intersections of social/affective touch and psychiatry: Implications of 'touch hunger' during COVID-19](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/0020764021997485)," published February 24, 2021 in the International Journal of Social Psychiatry; [retracted](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/00207640211063062)on November 26, 2021. See our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2021/11/30/journal-retracts-three-papers-including-two-on-covid-19-because-trainee-editor-committed-misconduct/). - [Calcifediol Treatment and COVID-19-Related Outcomes](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3771318)," preprint posted to Preprints with The Lancet on January 22 and removed on February 19. Our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2021/02/19/widely-shared-vitamin-d-covid-19-preprint-removed-from-lancet-server/). - " [Can quantitative RT-PCR for SARS-coV-2 help in better management of patients and control of coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7667399/)," published on November 16, 2020 in Indian Journal of Medical Microbiology; unknown date of [retraction](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0255085720300190?via%3Dihub). - " [Can Traditional Chinese Medicine provide insights into controlling the COVID-19 pandemic: Serpentinization-induced lithospheric long-wavelength magnetic anomalies in Proterozoic bedrocks in weakened geomagnetic field mediate the aberrant transformation of biogenic molecules in COVID-19 via magnetic catalysis](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048969720363592)," published in Science of the Total Environment on October 8, 2020, "temporary removal" on November 5, 2020, subsequently retracted on an unknown date. Our coverage [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/10/29/amulets-may-prevent-covid-19-says-a-paper-in-elsevier-journal-they-dont/). - " [Can Your AI Differentiate Cats from Covid-19? Sample Efcient Uncertainty Estimation for Deep Learning Safety,](https://api.deepai.org/publication-download-pdf/can-your-ai-differentiate-cats-from-covid-19-sample-efficient-uncertainty-estimation-for-deep-learning-safety)" reportedly to be presented at the ICML 2020 Workshop on Uncertainty and Robustness in Deep Learning in July, 2020, removed sometime before June 17, 2020. [Improbable Research](https://www.improbable.com/)discusses it [here](https://www.improbable.com/2020/06/16/dead-salmon-spirit-can-you-not-tell-cats-from-covid-19/). - " [Cardiovascular Disease, Drug Therapy, and Mortality in Covid-19](https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa2007621)," published in the New England Journal of Medicine on May 1, 2020, subjected to an [expression of concern](https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMe2020822?query=recirc_curatedRelated_article)on June 2, 2020 and [retracted on June 4](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/06/04/lancet-retracts-controversial-hydroxychloroquine-study/). - " [Characteristics and risk factors for COVID-19 diagnosis and adverse outcomes in Mexico: an analysis of 89,756 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases](https://erj.ersjournals.com/content/early/2021/02/18/13993003.02144-2020)," published in the European Respiratory Journal on July 31, 2020, and [retracted](https://erj.ersjournals.com/content/57/3/2002144)on March 4, 2021. - " [Changes in depression and suicidal ideation under severe lockdown restrictions during the first wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in Spain: a longitudinal study in the general population](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/epidemiology-and-psychiatric-sciences/article/changes-in-depression-and-suicidal-ideation-under-severe-lockdown-restrictions-during-the-first-wave-of-the-covid19-pandemic-in-spain-a-longitudinal-study-in-the-general-population/AAC8019556A15034B5E8AA1856E3F204)," published on June 2, 2021 in Epidemiology and Psychiatric Sciences; [retracted](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/epidemiology-and-psychiatric-sciences/article/changes-in-depression-and-suicidal-ideation-under-severe-lockdown-restrictions-during-the-first-wave-of-the-covid19-pandemic-in-spain-a-longitudinal-study-in-the-general-population-retraction/7D58D5FE5B5BEAED06642AF353EF0F27)on March 13, 2023. - " [Characterization of all small RNAs in and comparisons across cultured megakaryocytes and platelets of healthy individuals and COVID-19 patients](https://www.jthjournal.org/article/S1538-7836(23)00592-5/pdf)," published on August 7, 2023 in the Journal of Thrombosis and Haemostasis; [temporary removal](https://www.jthjournal.org/article/S1538-7836(23)00592-5/pdf)on unknown date. - " [Chinese medical personnel after the COVID-19 pandemic](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S014067362300394X)," published on March 25, 2023 in the Lancet; [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673623006918)on March 31, 2023. - " [Chinese medical staff request international medical assistance in fighting against COVID-19](https://www.thelancet.com/journals/langlo/article/PIIS2214-109X(20)30065-6/fulltext)," letter in The Lancet published February 24, 2020 and [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2214109X20300760)February 26, 2020. More context [here](http://retractionwatch.com/2020/02/27/lancet-journal-retracts-letter-on-coronavirus-because-authors-say-it-was-not-a-first-hand-account-after-all/). - " [Chinese mental health burden during the COVID-19 pandemic](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ajp.2020.102052)," published on April 14, 2020 in the Asian Journal of Psychiatry; [EOC](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1876201820305220?via%3Dihub)issued September 3, 2020; [retracted](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1876201820305955)on November 4, 2020. Note: Retraction Watch does not draw a distinction between withdrawal and retraction, because journals that have done so have typically done it to justify not saying anything about why a paper was retracted, and to sometimes make a paper disappear without a trace. Richard Sever, co-founder of bioRxiv and medRxiv, asked that we include a comment from him about how the processes for withdrawing preprints and retracting journal articles may differ: Journals may retract a paper at the authors' request and/or if the editors identify fundamental flaws that would have precluded acceptance if spotted during review. [RW: Note that some journals insist that they cannot make such moves without authors' permission.] A preprint is usually withdrawn only at an authors' request. A preprint server will not typically withdraw a flawed preprint against the wishes of the author, since the server made no claim to have peer-reviewed and certified the scientific content in the first place. At the same time, preprint servers *will* withdraw a preprint against the authors' wishes in instances of fraud, ethics violations, dangerous material, or legal issues. It is thus the nature of preprints that there will be some that contain errors but are not withdrawn and would not appear in the above list. [RW: The same is, of course, true of some papers in peer-reviewed journals.] Like Retraction Watch?
